intro: Campanula hochstetteri, commonly known as the Hochstetter's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions. Campanula hochstetteri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
